body_html:
@cpuhrsch First of all, I am not familiar with PyTorch.

You should not use ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}. You should specify a directory position relative to ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR} instead. Please check the include and lib directories for sleef is good. That contrib directory is just an example.

In the CMakeLists.txt in the root directory, requirement of version 3.2 is specified. I think you don't need to specify cmake version requirement here.
